fields.description:
h3. Summary

The banner letting users know that their maintenance is about to expire is shown to {{ADMIN}} level users. However the REST endpoint that handles hiding the banner requires {{SYS_ADMIN}} level privileges. 
This means that hiding the banner as an {{ADMIN}} can never succeed and the banner will continue to be shown. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create user
# Give user {{ADMIN}} permission
# Enter license that expires in under 30 days
# Try to dismiss the banner that is shown

h3. Expected Results

The banner is dismissed.

h3. Actual Results

The banner is not dismissed and appears on subsequent page loads. 
A {{401 Unauthorized}} error is logged to the Browser console. 


h3.Workaround

Temporarily elevate the user's permission to {{SYS_ADMIN}} to dismiss the banner or lower the user's permission below {{ADMIN}} (the banner is only shown to users with {{ADMIN}} or higher permission)
fields.summary: Support Tools Banner can't be dismissed by ADMIN
Support for providing the committer (in addition to author) in the API

fields.description: Currently, the (awesome) search in Bitbucket covers code and repository names. It would be great if it indexed pull requests too. It would enable users to search for text within pull request titles or descriptions (or even comments).
fields.summary: Search should also index pull requests

fields.description:
We've encountered situations where PDF files are not always handled as binary files in the source view of a repository. Instead of seeing "Download to view this file", we see the source of the file, including unreadable binary streams embedded in the file. It appears as though BSERV is only checking a subset of the lines in the file for binary data, so larger files with binary streams towards the end may be incorrectly identified as text/source.

PDF should always be considered a binary file.
fields.summary: PDF files not always handled as binary files

fields.description:
Frequently I'm added to a list  of reviewers as I'll have small portions of review ability, or good for an initial scan. It would be really nice to have a way to silence the notification at the top so it doesn't distract from new incoming reviews.

A previous system I've used would separate types of approvals: "This looks good" vs "Approve to merge" By default when you clicked approve it would have both options selected but you could uncheck one to show that the could has been checked and looks good, but you aren't comfortable to approve merge without additional checking.

Thoughts?
fields.summary: Ability to mark PR as ignored (or deferred)
Cannot add comment to last line of a file in a pull request

When searching for a repository using the search feature in 4.6+, add the following features to the drop down of results:

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a new file is created and added in the same commit where a merge conflict is being resolved, that new file will fail to open in the browser. Attempting to open the file returns a 500 error to the user, and generates a NullPointerException in the logs.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attempt to merge a branch on the command line that will generate a merge conflict.
# Create a new file.
# {{git add}} the file(s) containing conflicts to resolve the conflict.
# {{git add}} the new file.
# Commit the changes.
# Push the changes.
# Navigate to the repository in the browser, and open the newly created file.

h3. Expected Results
The contents of the file are displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The user receives a 500 error in the browser.
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-bitbucket.log file:
{noformat}
2016-05-31 15:32:19,930 WARN  [http-nio-7990-exec-7] smaruvada @3H8VA8x932x688x0 10mi4n 192.168.10.1 "GET /projects/META/repos/puppets/browse/crash2 HTTP/1.1" c.a.s.i.w.s.f.AvatarUrlFunction Error getting avatar URL for null
java.lang.NullPointerException: person
	at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkNotNull(Preconditions.java:226) ~[guava-18.0.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.stash.internal.avatar.ConfigurableAvatarService.getUrlForPerson(ConfigurableAvatarService.java:199) ~[bitbucket-service-impl-4.6.1.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.plugin.util.ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.invoke(ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.java:26) ~[atlassian-plugins-core-4.1.8.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.stash.internal.web.soy.functions.AvatarUrlFunction.getUrl(AvatarUrlFunction.java:80) [classes/:na]
	at com.atlassian.stash.internal.web.soy.functions.AvatarUrlFunction.apply(AvatarUrlFunction.java:67) [classes/:na]
	at com.atlassian.stash.internal.web.soy.functions.AvatarUrlFunction.apply(AvatarUrlFunction.java:23) [classes/:na]
	at com.atlassian.soy.impl.modules.SoyJavaFunctionAdapter.computeForJava(SoyJavaFunctionAdapter.java:34) [soy-template-plugin-4.3.0.jar:na]
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
This case was tested by multiple customers in version 4.3.2, and the issue did not exist.

h3.Workaround
# Commit new files in a separate commit from the merge commit. One customer has merge commits already imported from a forked repository, however, and cannot use this workaround.
# Create a new commit for all the files that are inaccessible. The files will be accessible after pushing this commit.
fields.summary: Adding a new file while resolving a merge conflict causes a 500 error when that file is opened in Bitbucket Server

fields.description:
Bitbucket can use the commit message to pre-populate the description of the pull request. However, it truncates the commit message at around 18 lines. See screenshot.

This is inconvenient, as users have to go back to their commit message and copy-paste the full message back into the description box. There isn't a limit on the length on the description of the pull request (or at least we haven't reached it).

I've attached the text I used for the commit message in the screenshot. Whilst this example is extreme, we do find that real commit messages are often longer than the truncation limit on Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Pull request information truncates commit messages

fields.description:
If I have a Jenkins build whose name is '#7-foo/bar', then Bitbucket shows '#7-foo\/bar' in its modal popup. See screenshot.

This is a common occurrence when Jenkins builds are named according to the branch they built. If I have a branch 'feature/foo', then Jenkins creates a build named '#123-feature/foo'. Bitbucket shows 'myproject '#123-feature\/foo'.
fields.summary: A / character in a Jenkins build name is double-escaped in the Bitbucket UI

fields.description:
The situation is following:
Some comment is hidden because the part of the file that comment applies to has changed
I try to make a reply to that comment, because I have e.g. ongoing thread with my colleague
If I enter colon (":") whole page breaks. It darkens, comment that I was writing disappears and it seems that Javascript stops functioning. 

Solution:
Refresh whole page and type the comment again

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When navigating Bitbucket Server using a screen reader, elements in the sidebar (such as the 'Commit' icon, 'Branches' icon, 'Pull request' icon and 'Settings' icon) have no readable text.

h4. Description from BSERV-8608 where this was previously tracked:
Some of the feature in Bitbucket Server are not fully accessible when accessed through a [screen reader|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Screen_reader] (e.g. [ChromeVox for Chrome|https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/chromevox/kgejglhpjiefppelpmljglcjbhoiplfn]).

In particular the following links are *not read correctly*:

+In the *project* view+ when the sidebar is collapsed
- Settings 'cog' icon -> no text is read

+In the *repository* view+ when the sidebar is collapsed
- 'Commit' icon -> no text is read
- 'Branches' icon -> no text is read
- 'Pull requests' icon (when there are no open pull requests) -> no text is read
- 'Pull requests' icon (when there are open pull requests) -> only the number of pull requests is read
- Settings 'clog' icon -> no text is read
fields.summary: No accessibility text is read for sidebar navigation items when sidebar is collapsed

{panel:title=Atlassian status as of Dec 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi everyone,

Thanks to everyone for voting and commenting on this suggestion. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with Bitbucket Data Center.

We spend a significant amount of time determining our product investments in Bitbucket Data Center. Unfortunately, we are not planning to address this suggestion in the next 12 months. In the last year, we have resolved many of the highly voted suggestions like Reviewer groups, Pull request templates, capability to enable/disable source branch deletion on merging pull requests and our upcoming roadmap includes a number of other top voted suggestions, including repository archiving. Please check out our [public roadmap|https://www.atlassian.com/roadmap/data-center?product=bitbucket] for more details on the coming soon and future items.

I understand that this may be disappointing, but it’s important for us to be open, honest, and transparent with our customers. Product feedback is collected from many different sources and is evaluated when planning the product roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

Cheers,
Imran Khan
Product Manager - Bitbucket Server and Data Center
{panel}
 

The code search shipped with 4.6.0 does not handle punctuation well when indexing code. In order to locate occurrences reliably, it should be improved to allow for search criteria with certain punctuation characters taken into account.

Comments with example searches and example results are very welcome to help us cover the right set of characters.

As a workaround it is possible to search for adjacent strings (> 2 characters each) separated by punctuation using phrase syntax. eg to find left_pad you could search for "left pad" (including quotes).

Original description:

Hi,
we have installed the version 4.6.0 of the bitbucket server and will replace the stash soon.
In the document:
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/search-for-code-in-bitbucket-server-814204781.html]
the options and restrictions of the code search are documented.

In our company we have a lot of projects and repositories which means that there is a need to find code for global refactorings in a very exact way that result in a small amount of matches.

Because of that need, the following restrictions are not good for the results we get:
 # All punctuation characters are removed
 # Case is not preserve
 # Regular expressions in queries are not supported

Is there a plan to improve the query posibilities in the next releases?

One small improvement might help to minimize matches. If we get a filename: key word beside the ext: key word to restrict our search.

Is there already such a key word?

Regards
Harald
fields.summary: Punctuation aware code search

fields.description:
I'm in a pull request with two other coworkers reviewing a body of work by a fourth coworker.

I have left line specific comments on three files, which show up in Overview on the pull request, and other people can see them in the files themselves.

However, a coworker of mine has left comments on a File, and I cannot see these comments, nor do they show up on the Overview summary of the pull request. Only she can see these comments.

Is this a known issue with our version of Stash?
fields.summary: Can't see other's file comments in a pull request

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When accessing files under "subtree" in a repository from the UI, 500 error is shown.
This problem only happened immediately after adding "subtree", however, if we changed the problematic files even once, the files were shown correctly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a repository which is named "main"
# Clone "main" repository on local, commit some changes and push the changes to the repository
# Create a repository which is named "sub"
# Clone "sub" repository on local, and execute the following commands
{code}
$ touch test.txt
$ git add test.txt
$ git commit -a -m "added test.txt
$ git push
{code}
# Go to the directory where "main" repository" locates on your local
# Execute the following commands
{code}
$ git remote add sub <BBS_BASE_DIR>/scm/<PROJECT_NAME OR USER_NAME>/sub.git
$ git subtree add --prefix=sub/ sub master
$ git push
{code}
# Go to {{sub/test.txt}} in "main" repository on the UI

h3. Expected Results

{{sub/test.txt}} should be shown correctly on the UI.

h3. Actual Results

500 error was shown.
 
h3. Notes

* This problem didn't happen on Stash 3.6.1 at least
* After committing some changes to the problematic files, they were shown correctly

h3.Workaround

As I mentioned above, reflecting some changes to the files solve this problem.
fields.summary: When accessing files under "subtree" in a repository from the UI, 500 error is shown

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Branch/ref permissions are not respected by the Tags REST API. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a simple restriction to disable tags, e.g.: refs/tags/**
# Try to create a tag via a normal git push
# Try to create a tag via the REST API


h3. Expected Results
* Both the git push and the API call should fail

h3. Actual Results
* The git push fails, however the API call bypasses the branch permissions and succeeds

h3.Workaround
n/a
fields.summary: Tags REST endpoint bypasses branch permissions

fields.description:
We know that there is a 1 minute timeout limitation on the merge page. This causes problem when the merge hook requires more than 1 minute to finish the work therefore we implement something to handle this case. Here is the flow:
# When PR page is loaded, Stash calls the merge hook.
# Merge hook makes a REST call to the backend.
# The backend starts validating config.
# Polling for 40s for the result.
## If validation finishes within 40s, returns result to Stash as soon as we've got the result.
## If validation cannot finish within 40s, return False and veto in merge hook.
## The validation result is cached in our backend.
# At any time, there can be other user opening the same PR page.
# Merge hook is loaded and making the same call to backend.
# Backend determines if this is the same request (same repo, pull request id, from reference, to reference).
# If there is already a job processing this validation, returns False to merge hook and veto.
# If validation result is in cache, returns the result.

The problem happens in this way:
# Once the PR page is loaded, user click on Merge (before merge hook got the result).
# Then user click 'Merge' button in the popup attempting to merge (because user does not know the merge hook is still processing).
# The popup closes itself. I guess it triggers the merge hook again because I see another request sending to our backend.
# A triangle with exclamation mark shows the veto message about validating. Merge button disabled.
!snapshot2.png!
# After some seconds, the validation finishes and the triangle disappears itself because validation passed. Merge button becomes enabled.
# Click Merge. Popup comes out with Merge button disabled and the loading icon stale.
!snapshot1.png!
# Close the popup and click Merge again. Same stale popup.
# Refresh the page. Since our backend returns the cached result immediately, we are able to merge by clicking Merge and click Merge in the popup.

From Stash access log, I see it's done by two calls: merge (POST) and automerge (GET). I guess the merge (POST) call is made by the Merge button in popup which tries to get the result from automerge (GET). When this problem happens, the popup never issues automerge (GET) to Stash server. It just pops up and do nothing, showing the stale loading icon. The PR page is able to obtain the latest result by making triangle disappeared and enable the button but the popup is not able to handle that.

fields.description: When writing comments in a PR, I often make reference to other files in the PR. I'd like to be able to easily link to those files so that the reader of the comment can quickly jump to it. Some form of auto-complete would be ideal. For bonus points, allow linking to specific lines in the target file.

fields.description:
Merge commit messages usually contain all commit messages from one branch. This includes the exact text from any Smart Commits included in the merge, causing all commands to be executed a second time.

i understand JIRA 7.1 included an improvement where duplicate time entries are ignored, in an attempt to solve the problem of merge commits containing time entries, but the #comment's are still added every time and any status changes (#ready-for-test, ...) are also carried out. The comments are not very critical, worst thing that happens is that it appears someone else adds the same comment I added, a few days after me (when they merge my commits into another branch). 

The status changes are dangerous though: if a ticket has since been transitioned to another status which happens to allow transitions back to the Smart Commit's status, the ticket might suddenly be reopened without anyone noticing, and without any indication as to why.

My suggestion: add an option for BitBucket Server to simply ignore merge commits when checking for Smart Commits.
fields.summary: Merges should be ignored as Smart Commits
Diffs where one side is empty do not render when SBS diff is used

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
While troubleshooting Elasticsearch related issues, some of the information are not added to the Bitbucket Server logs and the Support Zip.
By having the Elasticsearch details added to the logs and the Support Zip, the troubleshooting of an issue would be easier.

h3. Suggested Solution
For customers using their own Elasticsearch instances, it would be helpful to get more information about their Elasticsearch instance in Bitbucket Server Support Zip, like:
# Elasticsearch URL and port (/)
# Elasticsearch Version (in logs)
# Whether it's an embedded or external Elasticsearch instance (x)
# Username used to connect to the Elasticsearch instance (/)

A flag specifying if the bundled or a remote Elasticsearch is used would be useful as well.
fields.summary: Add Elasticsearch environment information to Bitbucket Server Support Zip
New Trial Install Fails to Start, Plugin `ssh-plugin` Fails to Load

fields.description:
Please consider reopen this suggestion/request and make it an out of the box feature in Bitbucket. Thanks.

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-7486

I'm not sure why this BSERV-7486 feature is closed, I would like to reopen this suggestion/feature request.  I don't under stand why Atlassian makes the FROM in notification email in Crucible to use the user's name, but email notification in Bitbucket is not, which make it difficult to filter when you have 20+ developers working on 30+ code in Bitbucket since it will be difficult to filter out Bitbucket emails which only pertinent to yourself in the traditional email client, without the unique FROM address.

If you have access, please also see a support ticket which I opened for more details. Thanks.
https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/24/SSP-14643
fields.summary: Make bitbucket email to be from individual user instead from Bitbucket (repopen BSERV-7486)

fields.description:
Hello, we switched to Bitbucket Server 4.6.1, and a very much used feature is currently not working anymore.

When viewing a pull request, we always check what the difference in the code was. However, when navigating to the diff tab on a pull request, the code view on the right is not refreshing when clicking on a filename on the left.

Strangely, when viewing the diff on an individual commit this feature is working.

It probably has to do with this javascript error:
{code:java}
batch.js?analytics-enabled=true&analytics-uploadable=true&hasADMINPermission=true&locale=en-US&nps-…:6658 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'textContent' of undefined
{code}
fields.summary: Pull request diff tab not switching to source code when clicking on another filename

fields.description: For pull requests coming from a different repo (fork) than the destination repo, hovering over the link to the commit hash causes a "Page not found" popup (see attached).  It appears to be looking for the commit hash in the current repository instead of the submodule repository.  Probably related to the new commit message preview feature.
fields.summary: Mouse over submodule commit link in source view throws incorrect "Page not found" error

fields.description:
h3. Summary(Customer's usecase)
We have a lot of projects and repositories that is not open for everyone within our company. We want to limit the access to a project to user in a specific LDAP group so we can be sure that no one else can access the repositories in this project. But at the same time we want to let a project administrator(project creator) configure the plugins but they(project creator) should have no possibility to change anything that has to do with permissions, so they(project administrator) can't let users access a repository that is not allowed to have access. 

Right now we can't let users outside our small administration group to became project administrator for their project. This is because they in turn can let other users read, write and even give administration rights for this specific project, and that we can't allow for security concerns.

h3. Expected result
Limit {{Project creator}} to provide permission to other user with *admin* or *write* permission.
fields.summary: Limit project admin ability to grant additional permissions

fields.description:
Stash 3.x allowed administrators to disable STP - also known as "Support Tools Plugin" - and possibly other Bitbucket Server required plugins.
After an upgrade to 4.x, Bitbucket Server cannot start up because STP is a required plugin.

Current workaround(s)
Enable STP before upgrade.
Delete correct row from plugin_status table.
fields.summary: Bitbucket server fails to start after upgrade from Stash 3.x if STP was disabled

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After upgrading to Bitbucket Server 4.6+, Elasticsearch does not start automatically and the search returns "Search is currently unavailable".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upgrade Bitbucket Server to a version including the Code Search functionality (4.6+)
# Search for an item

h3. Expected Results
The search runs successfully, and the expected results are returned.

h3. Actual Results
The "Search is currently unavailable" is displayed in the user interface, and the following appears in the {{atlassian-bitbucket.log}} file:

{noformat}
ERROR [search-indexing:thread-1]  c.a.b.s.i.i.e.DefaultIndexEventWorker Indexing - Failed for repository <repository_name> (id: <repository_id>) with error: java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused
java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused
	at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.reportGet(CompletableFuture.java:357) ~[na:1.8.0_65]
	at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.get(CompletableFuture.java:1895) ~[na:1.8.0_65]
...
java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused
	at sun.nio.ch.SocketChannelImpl.checkConnect(Native Method) ~[na:1.8.0_65]
	at sun.nio.ch.SocketChannelImpl.finishConnect(SocketChannelImpl.java:717) ~[na:1.8.0_65]
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
Manually start the search by using:
{noformat}
sudo service atlbitbucket_search start
{noformat}
fields.summary: After upgrading to Bitbucket Server 4.6+, Elasticsearch does not start automatically and the search returns "Search is currently unavailable"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Pull Requests settings page allows users to require a minimum number of successful builds to merge pull requests. The available values here are 1-9, and this cannot be overridden. If users require a higher number it cannot be set.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow a higher number to be set here, e.g. using an input spinner instead of an input option select, to allow arbitrary numerical values to be set.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Allow setting minimum builds > 9 in pull request settings

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When installing 4.6.1 on an upgrade option. Text would appear that would indicate that Elasticsearch had not bee installed. 

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Install Bitbucket version < 4.6.1
# Upgrade to version 4.6.1
# You will notice text appears during the install saying that Elasticsearch will not be installed

h3. Expected Results
No text to that description appears unless the Datacenter option is selected

h3. Actual Results
The text appears in every upgrade option:
{noformat}
Elasticsearch will not be installed with this option.
{noformat}

h3. Notes
This only appears on the upgrade option, and only on the console option. This requires changes to the visibility options for the labels that are being shown in the console.
fields.summary: Visual bug in installer says Elasticsearch will not be installed

fields.description:
BSERV-4964 is a request for Atlassian to support the 
MySQL Replication using Global Transaction IDs.
Our database team specifically uses the feature for better replication in our HA environment.
Is there another workaround besides "Turn off ENFORCE_GTID_CONSISTENCY on the database" ?

This issue causes an error when we try to delete a repository.
A couple users said this fixed the problem:
  "grant temp permission to database user"
Do you support that workaround?

Would it be safe to go directly to the MySql tables to delete a repository?
  I wouldn't think so w/o understanding the schema.

Thanks for your help
Rex
fields.summary: Can you provide a workaround for BSERV-4964?

fields.description:
If the Elasticsearch service is running, creating a support ZIP fails because it tries to include the atlbitbucket-elasticsearch-x64.pid file, which is locked by the process. I would assume this file is unnecessary for support purposes, and should be excluded from the ZIP creation.

The system generates an error and does not finish adding all the relevant components to the ZIP file.

*Workaround*

Restart the Elasticsearch service.
fields.summary: Creating support zip fails if Elasticsearch is running

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When logging in as a user with certain special characters in the username (for example '@'), an error dialog is shown. 

h3. Environment
* Bitbucket Server 4.6
* User's local time zone does not match server time 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set server time zone to differ from local (computer/browser) time zone
# Log in as a user with an '@' character in the username (in this case 'user@example')

h3. Expected Results

No errors are shown. 

h3. Actual Results

A modal error dialog is shown. 
{noformat}
User user_example does not exist.
{noformat}

h3.Workaround

Disable time zone user onboarding by setting the {{feature.user.time.zone.onboarding}} flag. 
_Note_: this flag only disables the onboarding capability, and not the "Support for personalized time zones" feature (see [Bitbucket Server 4.6 release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BitbucketServer/Bitbucket+Server+4.6+release+notes]).
These are the steps to follow:
# Stop Bitbucket Server
# In your [{{bitbucket.properties}} file|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BitbucketServer/Bitbucket+Server+config+properties] add the following line
{noformat}
feature.user.time.zone.onboarding=false
{noformat}
# Restart Bitbucket Server
fields.summary: Error dialog shown for users with certain special characters in username

fields.description: Currently if Elasticsearch server is not reachable from Bitbucket server for any reason, the code search panel is still available in the application UI with no indication of the communication failure. An on-screen prompt to inform the user or disabling the feature might help make them more aware of the problem rather than issuing a search query and waiting endlessly for results.
fields.summary: On screen indication for any Elasticsearch connectivity related issue

Installer not installing Elasticsearch when user perform upgrade. This issue is only occurred when upgrade is perform on terminal from Bitbucket Server ver4.5.2 to Bitbucket Server ver4.6.1. The affected user running Biitbucket Server in a predefined environment of RHEL6 and RHEL7 without GUI. The absence of Java which lead to upgrade process take place in terminal instead of GUI.

fields.description: Upon triggering an initialization of a plugin(example), threads in these thread pools will inherit the MDC state. As the plugin initializes, it creates 2 thread pools, initializes the threads in them and inherit the MDC state from the triggering request thread. Any subsequent logging from these threads will display that MDC state.
fields.summary: Clear logging MDC when initializing new threads

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When attempting to view the JIRA Dev Summary commit panel for an issue that has commits in many forks (or generally many repositories), the panel can be slow to load or times out.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a repository
# Create many forks (enable fork syncing)
# Push commit with a JIRA issue key
# Go to the JIRA issue and attempt to view the commit

h3. Expected Results

The panel loads quickly.

h3. Actual Results

The panel takes a long time to load or times out.

h3.Workaround

No known workaround.
fields.summary: Performance problem in JIRA Dev Summary commit view with many forks

fields.description:
What is needed is an option to customise how branch names are set by default, originally their are composed by the issue key and summary of the issue in JIRA, although what we want is to customise it to set only the issue key without any summary or additional data.

As an example:

How it is now: branch name: JSP-3745-research-for-issues-on-jira
How we want: JSP-3745

We are able to change the branch name when creating it, although we want a global configuration that we won't have to change it every time.
fields.summary: Add option to adjust the auto-fill values for branch names in BitBucket

fields.description:
Sometimes adding commits that are adding new functionality with some duplicate code don’t display right.  In particular, it shows the new lines in the wrong place.  ‘git diff’ shows it the same way.  ‘git diff —minimal’ is better about it and often avoids these problems.

Example:
https://stash.sd.apple.com/projects/COREOS/repos/astris/pull-requests/404/diff

> git diff c3e5ffa9e5c7c3c9c033967708b58c3b27925de9...eng/PR-26272156 | wc -l
    1483
> git diff --minimal c3e5ffa9e5c7c3c9c033967708b58c3b27925de9...eng/PR-26272156 | wc -l
    1074

In this example, there are 400+ fewer lines to review, and it properly shows which functions are affected.

I’m also not sure the —minimal argument documentation of ‘spend extra time’ is applicable to the full system time since in my example the —minimal is actually the same or faster overall (both are consistently around 16ms total) since git diff spends less time outputting.  So while this might have a small performance hit on the diff generation, the performance gain on the page generation might actually decrease server load.
fields.summary: Add a way to do minimal diff (like git diff --minimal)

fields.description:
h3.Summary

When viewing a file's "Diff to Previous", the file is diffed against the first non-merge commit hash in 4.6.0 as opposed to 4.5.2 where it is diffed against the merge commit hash.

h3.Steps To Reproduce

Set up a remote git repo in both Bitbucket Server version 4.5.2 and 4.6.0 that consists of both push and merge commit hashes similar to this network graph:

!network4.5.2.png|thumbnail!

Commits are the same in both 4.5.2 and 4.6.0:

!commits4.5.2.png|thumbnail!

!commits4.6.0.png|thumbnail!

h3.Expected Results

"Diff to previous" view for the view should be the same in 4.5.2 and 4.6.0

h3.Actual Results

"Diff to Previous" view is different in 4.5.2 which diffs the file against the changes contained in the commit with the hash that corresponds with the merge:

!difftoprev4.5.2.png|thumbnail! 

whereas in 4.6.0, the merge commit has is skipped and the file is diffed against the first non-merge commit hash:

!difftoprev4.6.0.png|thumbnail!

h3. Cause

The reason for this behavior is due to how git handles the {{--follow}} flag, which is what Bitbucket uses to handle renames within the system.

h3. Workaround

Disabling the rename tracking functionality globally by adding the following to your {{$BITBUCKET_HOME/shared/bitbucket.properties}} will allow these commits to be seen as expected:

* {{commit.list.follow.renames=false}}
fields.summary: "Diff to Previous" view skips merge commit hashes in

fields.description:
Reviewers could not Diff of any of the commits associated with the Review. They should be able to compare Commit #1 to Commit #3 or Commit #2 to Commit #3 and add comments, etc. This is helpful for developers want to see are the changes since the last commit and not total changes in the 'Diff' tab.

1) On the "Diff" tab, Commit #1 and the latest commit are always compared. This does not help when all you want to see are the changes since the previous commit. Again, when someone added a new file and had multiple commits for review, it shows as the new file added and all lines highlighted as green in the 'Diff' tab.

2) Still on the "Diff" tab, you can click the "full source" button. On this tab, you can review commit history and do compare any two commits. This is exactly the type of compare desired. However, you cannot make comments on this page.

3) On the "Commits" tab, you can see a list of Commits associated with the Review. If you click one, you will see a compare of that Commit and the Previous Commit. You can make comments on this page. However, the comments are associated with the Commit and not the Review. The comments do not appear on the "Overview" tab or in the Activities Log. So if anyone was to look at the Review at a later date, they most likely would miss these comments.
We do not want to flip around tabs to achieve this, also need to capture every review comments involved as part of Pull request record.
fields.summary: There is no good method for comparing commits, and add comments within a Pull Request Review.

fields.description:
In testing, a pull request was incorrectly closed as 'remotely merged' by the new pull request rescoping.

Analysis shows that:
# the auto-merge merged release/1.16 into release/1.17 and raised a RepositoryRefsChangedEvent for it.
# auto-merge failed to merge release/1.17 into release/2.0 and created pull request #209 with the merge conflicts
# the event from 1. triggered pull request rescoping to run
# pull request rescoping incorrectly included the rescope request from 3. when rescoping #209. It included it because MySQL only has 1s resolution on timestamps and the PR scopeTimestamp == rescopeRequest.timestamp.
# the rescoping of #209 detected a gap. As a result 2 rescopes were performed
## gap: this conceptually rolled the release/1.17 ref back to before release/1.16 was auto-merged into it
## rescope: update release/1.17 to after release/1.16 was auto-merged into it
# because release/1.17 was fully merged in release/2.0 prior to the auto-merge in step 1, the scope was detected to be empty and the pull request was marked as MERGED

Problems:
* rescoping should ignore rescope requests that appear to already have been processed. It should not create a gap that 100% inverts the rescope it is going to perform next.
* the gap rescope in step 6 should have been classfied as a DECLINE instead of a merge
fields.summary: Pull requests created when auto-merge fails are incorrectly closed as 'remotely merged'

fields.description:
We recently upgraded from Stash 3.8 to Bitbucket Server 4.5.2. After doing so we noticed a quirk/issue with our JIRA to Bitbucket Server integration:

In our Bitbucket Server repository, we had enabled 3 of the 4 branch prefixes for our branching model:

# Feature, set with branch prefix "issue/"
# Hotfix, branch prefix "patch/"
# Release, branch prefix "release/"

With Stash 3.8, if we used JIRA's Stash integration to create a branch from an issue of type "Bug" (which does not map to any of the 3 Bitbutcket Server branch types we have configured), Stash's "Create branch" screen would simply default to a Branch Type of "Feature" and give us the expected branch prefix "issue/".

Now, after we upgraded to Bitbucket Server, if we use the same JIRA integration with Bitbucket Server to create a branch from an issue of type "Bug" (which still does not map to any of the 3 Bitbutcket Server branch types we have configured), Bitbucket Server's "Create branch" screen would default to a Branch Type of "Feature", but it will NOT append the branch prefix "issue/" - it won't append anything in this case.

If the user toggles the Branch Type dropdown (i.e. even though it shows "Branch Type" set to Feature, click the "Branch Type" dropdown and select Feature again), then the expected branch prefix "issue/" will be appended.

We noticed the issue in Bitbucket Server 4.5.2 (because that's what we upgraded to from Stash 3.8), but after some testing trial and error I discovered this issue first cropped up in Bitbucket Server 4.1.6 (or at least, sometime after Bitbucket Server 4.0.1 - which still behaved like Stash 3.8.x, 3.9.x, etc.).

I've attached a couple of screenshots to illustrate this.

We would like the old behavior back (i.e. the pre-Bitbucket Server 4.1.6 behavior).

Or if we can't get the original behavior, if would could assign the same branch prefix to multiple branch types in Bitbucket Server - so if we could set "Feature" and "Bugfix" branch types to the same prefix ("issue/" in our case), that would also be acceptable.

Basically we don't need to differentiate between Features and Bugfix branches with different branch prefixes - we prefer them to be under the same prefix.

fields.description:
Choosing "Create branch" for an issue does not always show the right project in Stash.

Having multiple projects, the last one you visited in Stash seems to be these when coming from JIRA via "create branch". Last visited repo in stash is not equal to the project I came from in JIRA.

Steps to reproduce:
# Have multiple projects in JIRA and Stash
# Browse a repo for PROJECT TWO in Stash, click around, view merged pull request etc
# Open PROJECT ONE in JIRA, click create branch on an issue you are going to start working on
# You get redirected to Stash. Everything seems to look fine, but hang on; PROJECT TWO is automagically selected instead of PROJECT ONE where you came from in JIRA, and expected to create a ticket for.

How bad is this problem?
Very bad. This results in many branches being created in the wrong project by accident.

JIRA: v6.4.12#64027-sha1:e3691cc
Stash: v3.11.6
fields.summary: Create branch on an issue result in wrong project in Stash

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

SysAdmin facing issue with un-managed repository being forked by their developers. The downstream repository is being fork and left un-utilized. The un-used downstream repository is not being deleted by developer/user which cause accumulation of un-used downstream repository and space consumption.


h3. *Expected Results*

Allow SysAdmin to limit number of forked repository being created from an individual fork to minimize the under utilize downstream repository by the developer/user.


h3. *Workaround*

Based on the issue, I able to suggest the SysAdmin to turn off the forking ability.
* Go to the repository that required to be stopped forking.
* Click on {{Settings}} to direct to {{Repository details}}.
* Uncheck the {{Allow forks}} checkbox and save the configuration.
fields.summary: Set repository fork limit

# Select Branch 18'

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. In Chrome, Make sure your Plugin Settings is set to "Let me choose when to run plug-in content"
2. Click on the "..." menu next to the branch selector on any repo layout page
3. Copy branch menu item is has the blocked-Flash overlay, instead of clicking to activate it, click on the 'x' (or use the context menu) to "Hide This Plug-in"
4. Click on "Copy branch name" menu item
5. Nothing happens (no fallback dialog to copy branch name)

Intermittently, the menu item will trigger the fallback dialog after a while, with the message about Flash not being installed and a link to download it.

Need to investigate if ZeroClipboard can detect if Flash is installed, but disabled, so that it doesn't insert the 'bridge' element which is swallowing the click events which would otherwise be handled by the <a> element in the dropdown which triggers the display of the fallback dialog.
fields.summary: Copy branch fallback modal doesn't show if Flash isn't granted permission to run in Chrome

fields.description:
The 'Create Branch' feature allows users to create a new branch from BitBucket Server. The user is first asked to select which repository to create the branch in. This defaults to the last viewed repository.

The Branch From field captures where the branch is being created from. For the repository which is selected by default, this field defaults to its default branch e.g. master. However, when you switch the repository to another one, the Branch From field is not updated to then select the new repository's default branch.

Steps to reproduce on stash.atlassian.com:

# View the 'Bamboo' repository so it is the last viewed one
# Go to a JIRA issue on JDOG e.g. JPA-1435
# Click 'Create branch' to initiate the feature in BBS
# The repository selected should be 'Bamboo'. The branch from field should be 'master'.
# Change the repository to 'JIRA Cloud'.

Expected:
* The branch from field should now be 'master' as that is the default for that repository.

Actual:
* The branch from field is cleared.
fields.summary: Create branch: Re-select default branch for "Branch from" when switching repositories

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently the Elasticsearch pid file exists in the bin directory under the Bitbucket Server installation directory. Due to this the {{atlbitbucket}} user must have access to write to this folder. This can be seen as a security risk as the application (Bitbucket) has access to its own binaries/startup scripts. 

h3. Suggested Solution
The PID should be moved to a more acceptable location based on the environment that Elasticsearch is being run on.
 
h3. Workaround 
h5. Linux
Change line 42 of {{start-search.sh}} to change the {{piddir}} to an acceptable folder. 
If running as a service, the {{PIDFILE}} variable in {{/etc/init.d/atlbitbucket_search}} will need to be changed.
fields.summary: Pids should not be created in the bin directory

fields.description:
When showing a diff on the PR page in Edge, the content is displayed as black text on a gray background for 1-2 seconds depending on the size of the diff.

Edge developer tools shows that all that time is spent in scripting and styling during this. Two separate users both also noticed massive memory being used by Edge, but none if it is on the heap (it's something happening outside of JS-land and in the Edge process itself). The heap is relatively stable at 8-9MB.

It may be caused by recent LESS changes on that page because it occurred suddenly starting Feb 24th, after merging feature discovery code and some other minor changes.

It might instead be related to an Edge auto-update happening around the same time (but I don't know that one _did_  happen, just saying it's possible).

I find it unlikely that any JS changes caused this since we didn't make any that should be related afaict.

We should investigate by running Edge against an older version of BBS to see if it's reproducible there. That will let us know if the problem is in the code we just wrote or not.
fields.summary: Diffs load slowly in Edge

fields.description:
A user managed to add a tag with a high ascii number character (194 dec = Â).
This resulted in the Bitbucket backup client to crash with the following error:

ERROR  (15%) A backup could not be created. Reason: Some files could not be read in Bitbucket home. Please change their permissions to make them readable by the user running the backup client or exclude them from the backup using the bitbucket.home.excludes property and retry. The following files could not be read:

/data/stash-home/shared/data/repositories/nnn/refs/tags/AAA�AA_AAAA_AAAA

Then after a couple of days when the tag was moved to packed-refs, backups do not fail anymore, but when going into the administrative page for the repo in Bitbucket, the following error is displayed (with a grinning 500 error skull):

Error opening/reading [/data/stash-home/shared/data/repositories/nnn/packed-refs]
Please see your system administrator.

As git happily did swallow the character, so should Bitbucket backup client and Bitbucket server.
fields.summary: Bitbucket and Bitbucket backup client fails due to high ascii chars in tags

fields.description:
When the automerge fails, it raises a PR in the merging user's configured language in the UI. For example, see [#5005|https://stash.dev.internal.atlassian.com/projects/STASH/repos/stash/pull-requests/5005/overview].

Instead the auto-merge PR should be in the server's default language.
fields.summary: Automatic merge failure PR should be in the server's default language

fields.description:
When the user first load the page and hit enter, Stash does nothing.
However, if the user use j/k and then hit enter, the user can then be redirected to the target branch.
fields.summary: Branches page - first row is styled to have focus on page load, but doesn't actually
